{{also|thema|þema}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|la|de}} {{m|la|thema}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈteːma/}} {{a|standard}} * {{IPA|de|/ˈteːmɐ/}} {{a|commonly}} * {{audio|de|De-at-Thema.ogg|Audio (Austria)}} * {{audio|de|De-Thema.ogg|Audio}} * {{rhymes|de|eːma|eːmɐ}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|n|Themas|Themen|pl2=Themata|pl3=Themas}} # [[topic]], [[subject]], [[issue]] #* '''2010''', ''[[w:Der Spiegel|Der Spiegel]]'', issue [http://www.spiegel.de/spiegel/print/index-2010-28.html 28/2010], page 93: #*: Fast alle Amerikaner können ihre Wurzeln in fremde Länder zurückverfolgen, und deshalb ist Einwanderung ein '''Thema''', das die Identität der USA auf besondere Weise berührt. #*:: Nearly all Americans can trace back their roots into foreign countries, and therefore immigration is an issue that touches the identity of the US in a special way. # {{lb|de|music}} [[theme]] ====Usage notes==== * The normal plural is '''''Themen'''''. * The plural ''Themata'' is restricted to elevated, academic style.
